articles.title: Argentina's Milei will need time to scrap peso if he wins, advisers say
articles.description: Javier Milei, Argentina's radical presidential front-runner, will need time to carry out his campaign pledges of scrapping the peso currency and cutting taxes on grains should he win the election, advisers told Reuters, adding that he could avoid congressional hurdles by using executive decrees.
articles.content: Ramiro Marra, candidate for mayor of Buenos Aires and part of the inner circle of Argentina's radical presidential front-runner Javier Milei, listens to Milei talking to journalists, in Buenos Aires, Argentina August 24, 2023. REUTERS/Agustin Marcari... [3105 chars]

articles.title: Disturbing Discovery As 7 Human Skullcaps Found in River
articles.description: The human remains found in Argentina have been sent to a forensics lab for further analysis, officials say.
articles.content:
While walking along the San Antonio River on Sunday afternoon, a man in Argentina made a disturbing discovery when he saw a collection of seven frontal segments from human skulls submerged under the murky water.
According to the Córdoba police, the b... [2383 chars]

articles.title: Thiago Almada set for transfer before deadline amid Aston Villa links
articles.description: Aston Villa were linked with a transfer for Argentina international and Atlanta United star Thiago Almada earlier in the window
articles.content:
Thiago Almada, the Argentinian playmaker who was linked with a move to Aston Villa earlier this summer transfer window, is the target of Dutch giants Ajax before the transfer deadline at the end of the week.

articles.title: 'Coldplay dollar' and 'Qatar dollar' highlight Argentina's bizarre currency system as it weighs ditching the peso
articles.description: There are more than a dozen different peso-dollar exchange rates that are meant to stem outflows of the greenback.
articles.content:
Coldplay. Tabitha Fireman/ Getty Images
Argentina's economic burdens have spawned a number of dollar-peso exchange rates.
It's the result of the government's capital restrictions on dollar outflows.

articles.description: There are more than a dozen different peso-dollar exchange rates that are meant to stem outflows of the greenback.
